comments.body: I highly agree.

My take on Bigfoot would be a mob that is very similar to the Iron Golem, (like with about the same model, but naturally with its own skin). It would be passive unless you attacked any other passive mob in its territory, when it would turn aggressive and track you down, acting like an Iron Golem guardian of the forest. It would alert you that it is coming for you with some sort of bellow/scream, like when you make eye contact with an enderman. There would be a skin variation who would be white, the Yeti.
Awesome! Also a yeti variant to me would be awesome too!

Huh, I like this idea!

I'm curious what you have in mind for the purpur juice tho.

You could use the purpur juice to tame one of the enderfins

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360055992632-Enderfins
i'm curious if also there could be purpur combs as a parallel to honey combs , however there is a twist you can use these in a potion , its for you to decided tho...
Maybe some end flowers could go along with this.

Some following ideas, the wasp occasionally drops its stinger when killed which could be used, like flint, as the arrow tip, the purpur juice should be the first substance to give the flying ability in survival mode (it would last for 45 seconds), and I think the purpur juice should actually be called chorus nectar, since it comes from the chorus fruit and flower.
Thank you everyone for voting and commenting, just today I posted feedback on purpur juice, cuz Hori commented and wanted more info about it.  Make sure to check it out!!

Maybe the wasps are not poisonous but to make up for it, can sting repeatedly doing 2 hearts of damage. They may also not attack you if you wear BeeKeeper mask made of honeycombs around leather helmet
This seems to similar to bees in my opinion. There should be a different way to harvest the Purpur juice, and maybe they should give you levitation instead of poison when they attack you.
The purpur juice could be used to make a potion of levitation.

PurPur Juice should be used to make a Recall potion that takes you back to your respawn location. When using the respawn anchor, a point will not be consumed due to the Recall Potion bringing you there, not the Anchor itself.
They have to be involved in teleportation somehow, perhaps the hive block can teleport if you break its tree.
Perfect idea ! I just want it in minecraft !
Basically every group project ever. Anyways I think iron golems should not attack other units created by the same player.

Maybe extend this to llamas as well, If an iron golem gets hit by either a llama or a snow golem, they shouldnt retaliate, like come on, it aint like any of those are doing any / any significant damage to it,

Yes please.
And yes, even player-spawned golems will attack snowmens.

It's also worth noting this is going one way: Though it's hardly reproducible without cheats, if an iron golem attacks a snow golem, the snow golem won't retaliate.
Iron Golems should not be provoked by Snow Golems or a Trader Llamas.

I agree because where I made a world and messing around in it, my player built iron_golem killed my snow golem. Also jest because a villager damages an iron_golem with a rocket doesn't mean it should fight back!
What would they even look like? Dolphins, or what?

Think of a larger version of the current in-game dolphin with 2 extra dorsal fins, another pair of fins, and a sharper tail that swims side-to-side instead of up and down. The head would look more like that of a shark's. Karybdi would have two pairs of yellow eyes that emit light. The body would be a dark shade of blue, with the underside being a cream color.

Perhaps add tridents to their drop table, as an alternative source? And as long as Mojang is in the mood for upgrading items, perhaps a rare chance to get a "karybdi tooth" to upgrade/side grade the tridents, allowing them access to the sword enchantments?

Yeah, that’s a good idea, but instead of upgrading the trident, perhaps the karybdis tooth could be used to simply repair tridents. I don’t think Microsoft would like the idea of upgrading items right now.
What would they look like though?  Give us a description!
What if they have a big open jaw, and when you kill them, they drop prismarine crystals as well as a random fishing treasure?

Maybe this creature could look like mob A, the squid-like creature that would suck you into it's mouth? Another possibility would be more of an angler fish combined with a shark. I personally really like Floppy Gomper's comment on the tooth attachment, perhaps combined to the trident with the smithing table? Another idea could even be them camouflaging with the sand/gravel at the ocean floor, then popping out when the player is near.

I like this idea but I personally think that it would spawn uncommonly I like building underwater in survival and It is already hard for me to build with the drowned attacking me every second of the way so if this creature was like kinda rare and only spawning in like curtain water biomes like next to a plains/ocean biome or dessert/ocean biome that would be great.
Thank you for thinking about this modification,
Foxflight773
Very Cute
Noice
absolutely!
Yes. Also, I think if a pig is hit by lighting after 1.16 it should become a piglin no?
I think they should remain on your shoulder unless you press a certain key to make them dismount because I like to run around with a parrot on my shoulder

I agree with Slothstronaut27's suggestion. It would be so much better if the parrot would only come off if you would press sneak or another key specifically for dismounting the bird. I like to take it with me to my adventures a lot and I find myself falling more than climbing.
I think you should have to crouch to get them off your shoulder.
I would want them to stay on even if I'm crouching, I think falling 2.5 blocks or more like op said.
Great idea! I would love it if the parrots would stay on your shoulder more! Dismounting would be done with a key, or sneaking while jumping.
This would be cool af
This still needs to happen. Parrots aren't great pets when they fall off your shoulder constantly.
Parrots are already near IMPOSSIBLE to remove. I don't think this would help...

I think they should only come off when you shift! There was once a server I played on that had a plugin that made it work like that and it was amazing, I was actually able to have my parrots hang out with me wherever I went!

This is a great idea. The phantom as it works now is counter to all the other mechanics in survival minecraft. It is a mechanic that encourages you to skip the night. It is trying to force you into playing peaceful and interact with mobs only via safe farms.

I suggest that the phantom should do the opposite. A phantom should have a chance to spawn after a number of nights has passed. The phantom will only attack the player if they are sleeping. The phantom doesn't do much damage itself but it does wake the player up. This is only a problem if the player is sleeping out in the open or if there is an easy way for mobs to get close to the player. If the player is sleeping in a well defended base they just kill the phantom and go back to sleep. If not, the time it takes to kill the phantom will allow mobs to spawn. If the player is awake at night anyway the phantom is just one more mob to kill.

This idea is a call back to when mobs had a chance to wake the player up. It encourages the player to defend their bed and build defensive structures like lava moats etc. It means skipping the night does not break the game but in a way that is not too punishing. This adds back something that has been lost from the game over the years. Look here for my inspiration: https://youtu.be/ha1rO0btVLU?t=383

I saw another post to make Phantoms as hallucinations, basically phantom only attacking you, and you only being able to see the phantom when you didn't sleep. Maybe have phantoms do a charge attack and have it be more at ground level when homing in on the player, so the player can hit it. Now, it behaves like the old Ender Dragon. Even if you hit a Phantom, it escapes and you only hit it once, making it extra annoying. Maybe when you get hit by it, you are temporarily stunned instead of doing knockback so you don't get knocked off, and make phantom membrane make a hallucination potion or item that gives the effect (keeping slow falling) which adds a new combat mechanic. Good idea.

i think phantoms need an overhaul, their idea as a mob is just an average hostile in a way, other then flying and attacking in groups, their just a worse hostile and they kind of force you to use a mechanic that's not really giving you any real reason to use it, which i think is somewhat bad game design in a way.

i think phantoms/sleeping needs a overhaul.

I posted an idea similar to this but it got removed but anyways here is are idea some of my ideas to make phantoms better. It's a bit different so I will add some ideas.

Phantoms should have a bite that causes a debuff called insomnia. Insomnia cannot be cured by milk and forces the player to stay up.  Insomnia should last longer based on the difficulty.

  • Easy: 1 day
  • Normal: 2 days
  • Hard: 4 days

To stop players from sleeping before the phantoms spawn they should have nightmares. Every sunset there is a chance that phantoms will spawn during the night. If the player sleeps before phantoms spawn they will have a nightmare. Imagine this:

Where am I, I look around and see nothing but a perfectly flat grey plane shrouded by fog, I check my inventory but I have nothing... I punch the bleak ground below me but it doesn't crack, I hear a terrible shriek! Phantoms swoop towards me! I run. I must keep running! Is that... A portal? I escape through the portal and look around, I am in my house. In my bed... And then I hear the terrible shriek. The phantoms are here...

This will cause players to have to fight the phantoms. This is good because it allows them to be challenged by the night, instead of hiding in their huts.

Phantoms should not spawn within a certain radius from the bed the player last slept in. This would prevent us from having to take the time and go out of our way to use a bed every hour, as long as we are not adventuring beyond our base. The distance should be something like 32 to 64 blocks, not too confined, but large enough to keep yourself occupied within those chunks.
They should just remove phantoms entirely and add the blaze boss that we could've voted for

Phantoms could instead spawn at all nights, but only attack you if you have an insomnia status effect. The status effect would be permanent; only curable via milk (like how bad omen is), and wouldn't let the player sleep. This way the player can get phantom membranes more easily, without having to wait for 3 days without sleeping, and also keeps the challenge via the status effect (which can be easily removed).
The most annoying thing about them is that they fly down poke you and then fly away. They should fly down and attack the player for a little bit before flying away our maybe just not fly away at all.
Perhaps a new item that can be consumed that could repel them
The new update will make a bed rule where you can set how many people need to sleep to skip the night. So that fixes half the problem.

I agree that Phantoms are poorly implemented. They go against the established balance and punish players for daring to brave the night. Which is it's own punishment and reward, or else it wouldn't be 'braving' anything at all. So when you throw the phantom in the mix it just feels... wrong.

It's that feeling of if you try to do the right thing as a kid but your parents had a very specific idea of how it goes so no matter what you do you get punished.

Sleeping is tedious and skips a whole large section of the day night cycle. Not sleeping gets me attacked by oversized bats.

It really ruins the atmosphere of the game to be honest.
Plz vote!
Is it ok to vote for ur own idea?

I picture it being a small, thin little goblin thing and a smaller counterpart of the warden. It would be about 1 or 1 1/2 blocks tall and slouching, with one short arm and one long arm with a joint in it. When it stands straight and reaches as high as it can it reaches about 2 1/2- 3 1/2 blocks high, it will do this to extinguish torches. It will try to extinguish redstone torches as well, but they will only extinguish for about 1 redstone tick.

It moves slowly except when running away, it can also detect sound (like the warden) and will try to avoid the player.

I would prefer Goblings to be kind-a undeground villagers, peacfull society living in villages. But why not! Sounds interesting. Centipede is more creepy, though. It can climb whalls and ceiling, live in grimstone cracks

I like your Idea. I think these mobs shouldn't fly and will spawn naturally (rarely) like every hostile mob, but they will spawn only in height light level instead of low light levels. If there are no more torches nearby him he disappears and leaves particles behind. Very Creepy.

I think this mob should be less like a fling ghost and more like walking warped creature, like an enderman but more warped ant fits to the deep dark biome. and when you get close to them they will run away.

An other cool idea for this mob, when you get close to it it will run away.
Desert Tortoises eat cactus so they should add that too

how about including armor stands being recognized as a perching spot by parrots,   If there is a player, they prefentially go to the player, but if there is an armor stand and you stand near it with the parrot on your shoulder, it will hop over and you can have it stay there... 
or we need a "bird perch stand" we can make that looks like a short armor stand but the parrot will preferentially land on.
I would love to see this as it would mean the deeper you go the better the rewards but the mobs get harder too

I personally think that Minecraft should add more easter eggs like this. They are very fun to discover at random times. Once I was playing in a creative world and I had a channeling trident, I was trying to get rid of all the mobs around a village using the lightning. I threw the trident at a creeper, and instead of dying, the creeper turned into what I later discovered was a charged creeper. This would be a fun addition to the game, and I think it should be added.

What I think would be incredible for Minecraft is some form of a new dimension or an End Update. I've seen a lot of Dungeons End stuff, but I was wondering what could improve the End. Maybe some new terrain, bigger islands, new structures, etc. In any case, something new to fill the black and murky void of the End.
Servers with dragons

I like this, it really does fit in well with the Minecraft style, especially the use of clearing potion effects, like the usage they had in medieval (and present) medicine. Maybe you could catch them with a bucket to use in a milk-like effect negating potion, like pufferfish can be used in water breathing, except it only removes negative debuffs.
Maybe one for underwater that will pull you down to the ocean floor and drowned you.
So basically like an IRL Bobbit worm?
Pls do mojang

I was just about to post this. I loved mixing sheep in PS4 edition and I was disappointed when it didn't work in Bedrock. It was such a useful and fun addition! I would love to see it in Bedrock edition!
Great idea and i would love to see this added in to game.
thank you!!!!
I completely disagree with pangolin armor and swords they are heavily trafficked irl for their scales and it is the reason they are endangered.

Great great idea! I love the idea of pine martens running around the taiga biome.

Maybe not have them burrow like the meerkat though.
OH SO CUTE...maybe not have them be a recolored Meerkats...
I like this idea
would it basically look like a cluckshroom from Minecraft earth?
